For reasonable cost dining, of particular note was the excellent Tavola Calda and Rosticceria called ‘Delizie del Palato’ at the junction of Via Gregorio VII and Via S. Damaso, 10 minutes walk towards the Vatican from the hotel. This was well patronised by locals. The hotel breakfasts were excellent, with a wide selection of cooked and cold foods. It did pay to be down to breakfast fairly early, however as some of the cooked food did run a little low after about 8.30am. The staff were efficient and helpful, and the very well tended pool was excellent for cooling down after a hot morning’s sight seeing (some days temperature was around 32 centigrade). Would I stay there again? Most certainly – although slightly out of the way, this is a pleasant well run hotel with helpful staff and an excellent breakfast. With more moderate restaurant prices and slightly better facilities it could be outstanding. For example we didn’t use the hotel restaurant for evening meals, as it was way too expensive (33 euros a head for a three course meal). The same for the mini bar in the rooms with small cans of beer costing 5 euros. Instead we made up picnic lunches from the PAM supermarket on Piazza Pio XI. The hotel rooms were quite small, and there were no tea or coffee making facilities. The in house laundry service was also too expensive and the hotel could have done with a laundry room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August 2005. The rooms were nice and clean (except for the bathroom floor). The air conditioning work perfectly - which is not the case for a lot hotels in Europe. The pool is nice after walking in the sun all day. The only drawback is the location (or benifit depends on how you see it). Its out of the way of most of the hustle and bustle, so the bus or taxi is your best choice. Watch out for taxi drivers who charge too much. Ask the hotel how much it should cost. The staff speaks english are very helpfull. Go the grocery store to buy beer and stay away from the mini bar and the beers at the pool. The pool guy is the coolest, his name is Juliano and he gave us a ride in to town one night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, although out of the way”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. The staff was not the kindness especially, the breakfast staff. Overall this was a good hotel although a little out of the way. We paid about 50euros for the taxi (they called a limo). A taxi to go to the spanish steps or the fountain was only 10euros. Overall I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not our favorite hotel in Rome - but a quick one night...”
Reviews.Author: ita5724
Reviews.Content: A small room - spent 1 night - our first night in Italy after 30 hours of travelling - meeting up with an organized tour. Hotel was clean, bed was comfortable, bathroom was clean - no complaints there. Very far from anything - so what we were told was an 'easy' walk upon arrival to get a glimpse at St. Peter's was a 45 minute sweaty mess to get there, and then back. (Hadn't been in Rome long enough to master the bus system as we did by the end of our trip when we stayed at a better hotel...) Breakfast was the same as all hotels in Italy - nothing great, but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but a little far”
Reviews.Author: DanRandom
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week in Rome at the Jolly Hotel Villa Carpegna. The hotel itself was great. The staff was extremely accomodating, especially to this bunch of Americans with little knowledge of Italian. They were more than willing to check us in a little early upon our arrival. The free breakfast was great (especially for us, rolling in 5 minutes before they closed the doors), dinner was okay, the bar/lounge was great, lobby comfortable and clean, and we can only imagine the pool is great in the summer. The rooms were a bit small, with NO IRONS (bad for this poor packer), little dresser space, but great bathrooms and a nice TV (no alarm clocks, either). The hotel, in and of itself, was great. However, the hotel is a bit of a distance from central Rome. It's an easy 30-45 minute walk to Vatican City, and quite a hike to anywhere in the Ancient City. There is a bus right out front (woohoo #31) which will take you to the Metro or the Tram #8, which is great to downtown. I didn't mind the adventure (a weeklong Metro/bus/tram pass is 16 Euro - and worth it!), but it was a little taxing on my grandparents in their late 60s. But the busses run on time and frequently, so it's not a major problem. That would be my only warning to anyone looking to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights, and found the hotel very comfortable, if somewhat lacking in character. Good, clean rooms. The only negative comments about the rooms was lack of tea/coffee making facilities. Staff in general ranged from indifferent to unhelpful. Breakfast buffet average - no complaints. Located in a nice part of town, it is a 10-15 min bus ride from the centre of town with a reasonable bus service. Taxis are not too expensive either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Food”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my mother to Rome in October 2003, it was both our first time there. We were quite pleased with the accommodations. The hotel decor is very very nice, the rooms were great, a bit on the small side, but very nice overall. The restaurant was an absolute delight! The food was amazing. Their breakfast buffet was one of the best I ever had. The hotel also sits up on a hill, so the views are great, and I also liked the fact that it is located a little outside the center of Rome. So if not being in the center of town is a must for you, I highly recommend staying at the Jolly Villa Carpegna. The surrounding neighborhood is really nice and it gives one the feeling of a native. I will definltely stay there again when I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for rest and touring Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights, but they were relaxing. The western location was not a problem the transport system work well. Pool was essential, the rooms were cool and the stay was relaxed and quiet. The building is new but functional cool and clean. Breakfast was good and there was plenty on the buffet. You could easily walk as far as the Vatican or step on a bus down the road about 300 mtrs. I could not get Sky to broadcast in english on the TV but you do not need the TV here. I would stay here again, and would recommend the Jolly Hotel Villa Carpegna to friends

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. I'm rating this a 4 instead of a 5 only because of location; it's not in the center of the city. However, this was not a problem, and everything else about the hotel made up for it. To get into Rome, you had to go to the bus stop (a 2-minute walk from the hotel) and take a 10-minute busride into Rome. The room was large, clean, and modern. Air conditioning was on all night and hot water in the shower was always available (big pluses for European hotels). Breakfast was excellent and one of the best in Italy, served in their modern, large dining room. The swimming POOL was a must for the summer months! It was great to relax by the pool during the hottest hours and saving sight-seeing for early morning or late afternoon. True, staff wasn't so helpful, so buy a guidebook. Also, you must buy bus tickets from a tabachi shop, which closes around 2pm so buy a bunch early in the day.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Unaccomodating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was comfortable and clean but I found the front desk as well as management staff very unaccomodating. We were travelling with a tour group; Rome and the Jolly Hotel Carpegna was the beginning of my 10 day tour. After 25 hours of travelling I was looking forward to taking a nap and getting cleaned up before our welcome dinner that evening. At 11am the porter brought one of our suitcases from the bus but we were still missing one, which I informed him of at that time. 2 hours later he had not returned so I went to the front desk and was told that they would check into it for me and call me at the room. I waited another 1.5 hours without response before following up at the desk, this time the clerk told me that he was waiting on a call from the airline...I again informed him of the situation and that my bag was not at the airport but somewhere in the hotel. He then said that he would have the porter check the luggage holding room and would let me know. I sat in front of the luggage room for 1 hour and not one person checked ANYWHERE for my suitcase! When I approached him again I was told that it was probably delivered in the wrong room and that it was going to take some time to find it. Still, nobody moved in any effort to look for it. Finally, at 5 o'clock our tour director arrived back at the hotel and I informed him of the situation. Within 2 minutes of him addressing the staff they were all over the hotel searching! I waited 6 hours and not one person lifted a finger! The luggage was found outside the wrong room which was 2 doors down from ours. Those people must have just returned to their room and just set it outside the door because I had walked that corridor all day. The only comment I got from anyone at the hotel was "I cannot believe you didnt see your luggage sitting there...it was only 2 doors away from yours!" This didnt sound like an apology to me since I now had no time to get cleaned up before dinner. The most hospitable gesture they could have made if they didnt have time to try and solve the problem was to at least offer me some replacement toiletries so that I could have freshened up in the meantime.
